posts.post_content:
One of my all time favorite cards [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) just become irrelevant. Seriously, this at 3WW is absurd. I'm not going to say they killed Magic 2010 by printing this, but they sure crippled it.. In limited this dominates battlefield and in constructed it's still awesome. In legacy it rocks and in vintage it's just ok. At least they didn't add protection from black and red. 5/5 normally, but 4/5 from a vintage player's standpoint.
  
Casual play is just as frustrating for some if they keep printing stuff like this.
posts.html:

Posted By: revilolee (11/4/2009 5:27:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: As a huge fan of white Angel cards, of course I am thrilled to have this one in a deck! But, I must admit that the first time I saw it, I thought, "Shouldn't there be at least one more W in its cost?" It just seems so blatantly unbalanced. It really should have been 3WWW or 4WWW. Either way, with all of those white-type abilities, it should have had at least WWW in its cost. The "protection from Demons and from Dragons" part doesn't bother me too much. There are plenty of decks out there that won't be affected by these abilities at all. It's the fact that she's a 5/5 with flying, first strike, and lifelink. With these abilities alone, she should cost at least one more White.
posts.html:

Posted By: VirtueVsVice (2/2/2010 11:37:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's a powerful creature card with an efficient casting cost. Because of that, the card is insanely priced, especially since it was in a deck that won a Pro Tour qualifier. Even though there are plenty of low-cost creature removal cards in all formats, Baneslayer Angel demands attention when it enters the battlefield. It is a threat that cannot be ignored.  
  
[Juzám Djinn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juzám Djinn) is also a creature card that has a high retail price, because it is powerful and efficient for its casting cost. Thus, even after Baneslayer Angel rotates out of Standard, I expect its retail price to remain relatively high.
posts.html:
It's a powerful creature card with an efficient casting cost. Because of that, the card is insanely priced, especially since it was in a deck that won a Pro Tour qualifier. Even though there are plenty of low-cost creature removal cards in all formats, Baneslayer Angel demands attention when it enters the battlefield. It is a threat that cannot be ignored.

Juzám Djinn is also a creature card that has a high retail price, because it is powerful and efficient for its casting cost. Thus, even after Baneslayer Angel rotates out of Standard, I expect its retail price to remain relatively high.

Posted By: ClowWizardEriol (2/6/2010 4:36:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As everyone SHOULD be aware, it IS NOT that hard to get rid off...[Pacifism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pacifism), O-ring, [Journey to Nowhere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Journey to Nowhere), Counterspells, and the list goes on and on and on. Broken??? Perhaps...Invincible??? Now you're just being silly. Even a Reprisal can kill it. But power wise, i give it a 3/5...  
It's protection, not so great. Dragons and Demons, good ol' D&D (not THAT D&D). People don't use them as frequently as you think. Sure, you have your Ob Nixilis, or some other Demons out, or even your Hellkite Overlord or something, doesn't matter. Doomblade/ Terminate it, bye bye nuisance, hello easy prey.

Rating:

posts.post_content: Ridiculous. It's either slightly undercosted or has one (or two) too many abilities. I always thought [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) was balanced, but powerful. [Shepherd of the Lost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shepherd of the Lost) is a balanced angel as well for the same converted mana cost. But this ? It should've had less power and toughness (say, 3 each), be legendary or cost more, in my opinion. Rarity should have nothing to do with a card's actual power, but instead provide possibilities not present on the more common cards.
posts.html:

Compare with an old favorite like Serra Angel:  
  
Remove:  
vigilance  
  
Give:  
Rarity  
 +1/+1  
Lifelink  
First Strike  
Pro Demons  
Pro Dragons  
  
Its not any one thing she does, but that she does so much for such a reasonable cost. Not quite broken in constructed though, since she is as vulnerable as most creatures to removal.

posts.post_content:
I do agree that the card is ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) too cheap, and I play alot of white decks, but the card is containable by means of the humble, and common, [Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring), or equally humble [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade).
  
   
For those who say that the protection abilities are defunct because of the timing of the thing, I say this.
  
I have a casual deck that can have SIX dragons out on turn two.
  
That's right, 6 Dragons.
  
   
It is a rare occurance, but it happens, courtesy of [Dragonstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragonstorm) and four [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)s.
  
The one time it happened, all 4 other players conceeded
